verses.verse: Paul,<WG3972> a prisoner<WG1198> of Jesus<WG2424> Christ,<WG5547> and Timothy<WG5095> our brother,<WG80> to Philemon<WG5371> our dearly beloved,<WG27> and fellow laborer,<WG4904>
And to our beloved<WG27> Apphia,<WG682> and Archippus<WG751> our fellow soldier,<WG4961> and to the church<WG1577> in your house:<WG3624>
Grace<WG5485> to you, and peace,<WG1515> from God<WG2316> our Father<WG3962> and the Lord<WG2962> Jesus<WG2424> Christ.<WG5547>
I thank<WG2168> my God,<WG2316> making<WG4160> mention<WG3417> of you always<WG3842> in my prayers,<WG4335>
Hearing<WG191> of your love<WG26> and faith,<WG4102> which<WG3739> you have<WG2192> toward<WG4314> the Lord<WG2962> Jesus,<WG2424> and toward<WG1519> all<WG3956> saints;<WG40>

That the communication<WG2842> of your faith<WG4102> may become<WG1096> effectual<WG1756> by the acknowledging<WG1922> of every<WG3956> good<WG18> thing which<WG3588> is in you in Christ<WG5547> Jesus.<WG2424>
For we have<WG2192> great<WG4183> joy<WG5485> and consolation<WG3874> in your love,<WG26> because<WG3754> the bowels<WG4698> of the saints<WG40> are refreshed<WG373> by you, brother.<WG80>
Why,<WG1352> though I might be much<WG4183> bold<WG3954> in Christ<WG5547> to enjoin<WG2004> you that which is convenient,<WG433>

Yet for love's<WG26> sake I rather<WG3123> beseech<WG3870> you, being<WG5607> such<WG5108> an one as Paul<WG3972> the aged,<WG4246> and now<WG3570> also<WG2532> a prisoner<WG1198> of Jesus<WG2424> Christ.<WG5547>
I beseech<WG3870> you for my son<WG5043> Onesimus,<WG3682> whom<WG3739> I have begotten<WG1080> in my bonds:<WG1199>
Which<WG3588> in time<WG4218> past was to you unprofitable,<WG890> but now<WG3570> profitable<WG2173> to you and to me:
Whom<WG3739> I have sent<WG375> again:<WG375> you therefore receive<WG4355> him, that is, my<WG1699> own bowels:<WG4698>
Whom<WG3739> I would have retained<WG2722> with me, that in your stead<WG5228> he might have ministered<WG1247> to me in the bonds<WG1199> of the gospel:<WG2098>
But without<WG5565> your mind<WG1106> would<WG2309> I do<WG4160> nothing;<WG3762> that your benefit<WG18> should not be as it were of necessity,<WG318> but willingly.<WG2596> <WG1595>
For perhaps<WG5029> he therefore<WG1223> <WG5124> departed<WG5563> for a season,<WG5610> that you should receive<WG568> him for ever;<WG166>

Not now<WG3765> as a servant,<WG1401> but above<WG5228> a servant,<WG1401> a brother<WG80> beloved,<WG27> specially<WG3122> to me, but how<WG4214> much<WG4214> more<WG3123> to you, both<WG2532> in the flesh,<WG4561> and in the Lord?<WG2962>
If<WG1487> you count<WG2192> me therefore<WG3767> a partner,<WG2844> receive<WG4355> him as myself.<WG1691>
If<WG1487> he has wronged<WG91> you, or<WG2228> owes<WG3784> you ought,<WG5100> put<WG1677> that on<WG1677> my<WG1699> account;<WG1677>

I Paul<WG3972> have written<WG1125> it with my own hand,<WG5495> I will repay<WG661> it: albeit<WG2443> I do not say<WG3004> to you how<WG3754> you owe<WG4359> to me even<WG2532> your<WG4572> own<WG4572> self<WG4572> besides.<WG4359>
Yes,<WG3483> brother,<WG80> let me have joy<WG3685> of you in the Lord:<WG2962> refresh<WG373> my bowels<WG4698> in the Lord.<WG2962>
Having confidence<WG3982> in your obedience<WG5218> I wrote<WG1125> to you, knowing<WG1492> that you will also<WG2532> do<WG4160> more<WG5228> than<WG5228> I say.<WG3004>
But with<WG260> prepare<WG2090> me also<WG2532> a lodging:<WG3578> for I trust<WG1679> that through<WG1223> your<WG5216> prayers<WG4335> I shall be given<WG5483> to you.
There salute<WG782> you Epaphras,<WG1889> my fellow prisoner<WG4869> in Christ<WG5547> Jesus;<WG2424>
Marcus,<WG3138> Aristarchus,<WG708> Demas,<WG1214> Lucas, my fellow laborers.<WG4904>
The grace<WG5485> of our Lord<WG2962> Jesus<WG2424> Christ<WG5547> be with your<WG5216> spirit.<WG4151> Amen.<WG281> Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus a servant.
